content.label: This was a good series for puzzle games! Framed 1, Framed 2, please make a framed 3! Where it‚Äôs more than just the man, the girl, and the bad guy. I hope it shows a team of bad guys and a team of good guys. Seriously, framed is really good. Gotta make more games!
This is easily the classiest puzzle game I‚Äôve ever played. It‚Äôs not just a boring room with puzzles, this game has charm and is amazingly clean

you are a thief because you stole my money.

Doesn‚Äôt have instructions so you just have to somehow figure out you can re-arrange/re-use the boxes multiple times in a level - how does this make any sense? Comics are linear - one box for one point in time/space.

When I started playing the game I immediately realized the puzzles were a lot harder than the first game because halfway through the game I reached a level in the game where you were in a factory and the level was very complex and difficult because it was so hard I looked up a YouTube tutorial and when I found one there was sooo much to remember so who ever is reading this I would get this game if your up for a challenge and I knew some puzzles would be difficult but please love shack entertainment I would love for your team to make another game but please don‚Äôt make the levels so confusing where I want to throw my phone at my wall.

Although fun and the right amount of challenge, I finished the game in a day (and I‚Äôm no game or strategy genius) so that‚Äôs kind of frustrating that I had to spend $5 for a game I finished in less than 24 hours.
This game was enjoyable and better than the first game. Thanks for all your hard work and development. The ending was a little sad though but it is a great game. GOOD JOB!!!üëçüòÄüëã
I love this game and the original, thank you for creating them! Please make more, they are so much fun!

The level with the dog and the guard freezes on my phone. :(

This is a prequel, so I haven‚Äôt played the original yet, but this soundtrack is amazing! It also has an interesting story. It‚Äôs just too short, like only an hour, so it should be less money

I absolutely think this game is awesome, but it‚Äôs too short! I beat it in 60 minutes! It was super fun! Please make another or add more stuff to this one.

title.label: Game is fun but no sound

content.label: Apparently this game has amazing sound but not for me. Emailed support and was told to try reinstalling but no joy.
It's a good game but a waste of money I bought it and finished it in one day such a waste

title.label: Beautifully Animated Noir Puzzle Experience That Skillfully Improves The Series

content.label: Framed 2 is simply beautiful.  It can easily be beaten in under 2 hours.  The short length of the game, however, only serves to make every second of this puzzler more precious.  If you‚Äôre in the mood for a beautifully animated noir thriller, I could not suggest a better alternative than Framed 2.  The puzzles provide enough challenge to make one think, but will not frustrate players.  It is a smooth, sexy experience that will make the player feel intelligent and content.  However, it can be a wee bit repetitive near the end, which is why that short play time isn‚Äôt a bad thing.  Do not expect a great deal of replayability.  It‚Äôs a good game to thoroughly enjoy beating once.

title.label: Great puzzles, has more room to grow

content.label:
Like the first Framed, this sequel has a lot of fun puzzles in addition to more cutscenes and more art. However, as others have noted, it is a bit short, and some of the animations are actually more stiff than the original. Also, while there are new elements such as the hidden photos or the fight scene, it didn‚Äôt grow and incorporate more new elements, essentially offering more of the same. 

My hope is that the sequel will explore new mechanics, and hopefully expand more on the story. For a game that supposedly brings a comic book to life, there is no text; we don‚Äôt even know the names of the protagonists, and we‚Äôre still in the dark as to what‚Äôs inside the suitcase... I look forward to Framed 3. 

There‚Äôs one last thing I have to point out, and that‚Äôs the art in the menu selection, and it‚Äôs subtle way of storytelling. It didn‚Äôt make sense until I finished the game and realized that the slides were of the woman retelling the entire story of Framed 2 to the man in the trench coat. Very cool!

This was an amazing prequel which connected really well with Framed. Loved the little cinematics in between each level too! But I felt like it was a little short compared to the first game. A lot more difficult though which I loved

title.label: Way too short for the price

content.label: Good game otherwise

I loved the first but this one is WAY too short I liked the twists but at the end it makes no sense so the bad guy beat up the cop and some how the DIYING/HURT cop kills him and he doesn't shot the girl and where did the girl come. I won't buy number three
Nice game
Excellent game! I am hoping for more sequels!
Cannot wait for Framed 3 üôåüèΩüôåüèΩüôåüèΩ

Really enjoyed the first game so yesterday when i saw this one i bought it, however it is not downloading, just says waiting. I have like 10 gb free on phone, restarted the phone, stopped then restarted download but none fixed the issue so unsure what the problem is.  *update* user error, updated phone iOS and the game works. Like the first the story line is a little hard to follow because there is no dialogue, but also like the first its very fun with s couple of fairly challenging puzzles. Gj on app guys. Ill be buying #3 whenever i see it.
Captured & held my attention; loved theplot, the music, & the twists & turns of the story!   Waiting for FRAMED 3

Not a lot of games on apple or android are good they put time into there games but not much but this game is wonderful clearly there was motivation you guys had you put time and effort into this wonderful game (spoiled) I'm sad the guy died at the end he was so cool but hopefully there's a framed 3 coming out soon I would definitely buy it

Now I know that some people are like "what, it's a sequel" and no it's not because after the credits there is a scene that showers the girl grow up to give the man In the original game his motive or job. Amazing plot twist and also great story of how the man and the girl met, it's really creative *SPOILER ALERT* but it is so sad that the man dies in the end and the girls just sails off. The music is also fabulous and fits so well with all the scenes. Overall this is an amazing prequel to the original. Next I hope they make a sequel to the framed series. Something like "framed, the call" or it could be just framed3 with more fight scenes or a chance to fight the police instead of just sneaking up on them. This could also be a really good feature. Add knives or something too. You really don't have to but these are just suggestions. Amazing game ;)
Framed 1 was engaging and fun, but Framed 2 felt more polished and gave me many more hours of fun. I suggest both, and look forward to more from this developer.
This completes the storyline of Frame 1. Gameplay is basically the same, but puzzle are harder in my view

Got this on sale definitely worth it at that price. 

More difficult than the first game, as others commented, this can be because to figure out what a frame does you just have to try it. This can be both frustrating and interesting. Still a good play.

I love this game so much that I even started a comic on it! Still the main thing I wanted to improve if I worked at Loveshack Entertainment. The animations are a bit stiff and the music doesn't transition correctly in some scenes; however, I love this game and I want to know what is in that suitcase, and where did it come from? Not sure if there was a trilogy but it's not inevitable. Thanks Loveshack Entertainment for making this game.

The game doesn't use any sort of standardized rules, meaning on many levels there is no way to predict how enemies are going to react. Sometimes they respond one way, other times they do something else arbitrarily. You can't ever "learn" how things work so you end up having to try things randomly and hope to hit on the right sequence. This fake complexity is a cop out.

title.label: So much worse than the first

content.label:
The frames looked rushed and too thick to be classy. It looked cheap. Some of the backgrounds were awful, the wood in one frame for instance. The women somehow turned into a girl. The man became ridiculously and unrecognizably thin, I didn't know it was intended to be the same person until almost 10 frames in. Some of the actions in the scenes didn't make any sense. And here was one scene where if the man died the girl would sit down in her spot and rock like a baby which I found offensive and kind of demeaning. 

I will say the some of the background was beautiful like the last sunset and I thought it was still and interesting puzzle. The challenge was there but I just don't think the storyline and imagery were up to par with the first Framed.
Oh my word it's even shorter than the first one. It's frustrating only because it's such a GREAT game! MOAR!
Original concept, nice graphics and sound, some tricky puzzles, but overall too short.
The first one was quick, I finished in well under an hour. This one is no different. I'm not going to buy a third one if they make it.  It's fun, but there's no replay value and it's way too short.

title.label: Not a bad game, could be better

content.label: First time when I saw the description of frame in App Store. I think this is an amazing game with art, fun and puzzle. All of the elements are my favourite. When I played it. I am not sure how to say that. The art, yes, is very good. Puzzle, yes, it has. However, the fun, I am not sure. But I still think that is not bad. Now after couple months, frame 2 is here. I found the same problem. It is not very fun, and also too short. I didn't even know when I finished the first round of this game. This is very bad. When I play this game, I didn't enjoy it. Just watch this short story. It is really short, too short. But I still think the art and designer's idea is very good. But it could be better. I am looking forward to play frame3 and hope it will be better.
Started this game on my iPhone and would love to continue it on my iPad. Unfortunately Framed 2 doesn't support iCloud sync, so I'd have to start the game from scratch on my iPad :/
Great artistic direction, fun and innovative gameplay. That's what all games should be like , thanks for a great one, please make a third game in the series

This is perfectly made game with stylish graphics and nice plot. Unfortunately, it doesn't have anything common with logic. You need just iterate options, trying to find proper combination. Framed 1 was way more logical and thus challenging
P.S. Discount to $1 just few weeks after I've bought it for $5 makes this even more frustrating

I am a Framed, game lover and I couldn't wait when I heard Loveshack was going to unleash a sequel. I was extremely excited. It is unnecessarily difficult to get pass the cargo Bay Area. I have beaten Framed 1 easily and this is like extremely hard. Make it easier and I will consider redownloading.
A game with truly stunning puzzles and concepts, as well as an amazing style of animation, and it's own unique gameplay mechanics, framed 2 truly is hands down the best indie game of 2017.

I bought both Framed games after I bought Monument 2 and Apple helpfully suggested I might like this (Framed 2). I bought both never having even heard of them before. Why, you ask? Well it's not because I have unlimited disposable income but they looked like games made for me. :-) One off payment, brain teaser, well made, bug free. Yep. My games.

I was not disappointed.  As others have said Framed 2 is more difficult so I'm still playing that one in enjoyable - sometimes frustrating - fits and starts.  When I have a minute I go back to it.  There is palpable relief when I get through some of the more twisty ones.

I hope the devs make more.  I think the concept is top notch as is the execution.  Very well done!
Don't waste your money boring and over it in a minute!!!!!
